alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 10 at 3:30PM HST until March 11 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND THE WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... .A north-northwest swell continues to decline and surf has dropped below the warning threshold. Advisory level surf for the north and west facing shores will continue through Saturday as the swell continues to decrease. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 15 to 20 feet along north facing shores, and 7 to 10 feet along exposed west facing shores. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai, the north facing shores of Maui, and the west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
